column4: Holy.... cow. Beryl friggen' rocks. Too bad it doesn't work with FluxBox :( anybody know a VERY lightweight and fast non-WM thing? (not like XFCE, but are there others?)
I like blackbox...there is like openbox, fvwm etc...a google search for linux lightweight window managers brings up some stuff you might like
but it is said that any box WMs don't work with Beryl since Beryl is a WM itself :/
sorry I didn't read what you said properly
It's okay ^_^ thanks for answering though
ubuntu makes home folders world readable by default (as far as I know) so you will have to change the permissions on it appropriately
yes, and that's what I want to avoid in this case :P do you know what are the permissions I'll need to set?
that's ok :) we're humans after all xD
chmod -R 750 /home/your_user_name will take it off for everyone else...(depending on your group)...but might want to check the specific folders
huh, guess I'll put my stuff in a folder and chmod it o.o
Just do it on the root of you rhome folderand that should help you out
but wouldn't that screw up the chmod of other folders o.O?
I just did a test then, just take the world read off your /home/username folder
don't do a recursive, just chmod on the /home/username folder
no worries i hope I have not trashed your system :P
it worked perfectly, thanks for the help mdious & klobster ^^
good to hear, hope it continues working :)
